data.title: What To Do, Where To Go
data.meta_description: Grand Piano Series presents Water or Steel—Contradictions of Piano Sound featuring Pianists Quang Vo and Duy Vo 7:30 p.m. August 22.
data.text:
Please submit calendar listings and high-resolution photos to events@floridaweekly.com. Email text, jpegs or Word documents are accepted. No pdfs or photos of fliers, please. The deadline for calendar submissions is noon Wednesday for the following week’s publication.

We also encourage you to add your event to our online calendar using this form: naples.floridaweekly.com/add-event/.

THURSDAY 8.8

Evening on Fifth – Enjoy an array of live musical performances up and down the sidewalks of 5th Avenue South, plus dining, shopping and more from 6:30-9:30 p.m. August 8. 5th Avenue South, Naples. 239-692-8436 or www.fifthavenuesouth.com.

FRIDAY 8.9

80s Dance Party – The Molly Ringwalds performs at Caloosa Sound at 7 p.m. on August 9. Get ready to travel back in time for an unforgettable night at this 80’s dance party. Dress to impress in your best 80’s attire. Tickets start at $29. 2102 Edwards Dr., Fort Myers. 239-314-3757 or www.caloosasoundamp.com.

SATURDAY 8.10

Jazz Concert – The Jazzmasters perform at The Norris Center from 1-3 p.m. Free admission, but donations are appreciated. 755 8th Ave S., Naples. 239-213-3058 or www.naplesgov.com/parksrec/page/norris-community-center.

Disco Fever Party – Live music from Robert Williamson Duo from 6-9 p.m. Show off your favorite disco attire and be sent back in time with live music. 7941 Airport Pulling Road, Naples. 239-791-3663 or foodandthought2.com.

Magic of Motown – At Barbara B. Mann at 7:30 p.m. August 10. The Magic of Motown is a group of power vocalists backed by a six-piece band delivering all the hits from The Temptations, The Jackson Five, Diana Ross & The Supremes and more. Tickets are $44-$86. 13350 FSW Pkwy., Fort Myers. 239-481-4849 or www.bbmannpah.com.

SUNDAY 8.11

Anime-Fest – The Annual SWFL Anime Fest is back from 10 a.m.-5 p.m. on August 11 at the Hilton DoubleTree Hotel. SWFL Anime-Fest strives to be Florida’s best Anime Show, featuring fandoms of multiple genres with an amazing lineup of guests and attractions. General admission tickets are $20, and kids 11 and under are free with an adult. VIP tickets are available for $50. 13051 Bell Tower Drive, Fort Myers. www.swflanimefest.com or www.facebook.com/swflanimefest.

TUESDAY 8.13

The Wonder Games – A lecture on a 1936 roadside attraction once known as the Reptile Gardens, opened by the Piper family, learn the history of its early years and why the name was eventually changed 2-3 p.m. August 13. 3331 Tamiami Trail East, Naples. 239-252-8517 or colliermuseums.com.

Meet the Artist – Enjoy an evening of exploring and meeting the artists behind Marco Island Center for Arts exhibitions at 7 p.m. on August 13. Free to attend. 1010 Winterberry Drive, Marco Island. 239-394-4221 or www.marcoislandart.org.

WEDNESDAY 8.14

Sunset Stroll – Enjoy a guided boardwalk tour through the Corkscrew Swamp Sanctuary with one of the parks naturalists 6:30-9 p.m. tonight. Ticket prices vary and registration is required. 375 Sanctuary Road W, Naples. 239-348-9151 or corkscrew.audubon.org.

Comedy Show – Venturino’s Comedy Club presents Dougie Almeida featuring John Charles at 7:30 p.m. Tickets are $20. Located inside Embassy Suites by Hilton. 10450 Corkscrew Commons Drive, Estero. 239-471-6911 or www.venturinoscomedyclub.com.

UPCOMING

Save Your Stuff – The Museum of the Everglades presents a lecture on How to Protect Your Family’s Treasures from a Hurricane 11 a.m.-2 p.m. Learn how to salvage water-damaged valuables. Following this demonstration, a Brief History of Tropical Storms and their Aftermath in the Everglades area 2-3 p.m. will be presented. 105 Broadway Avenue West, Everglades City. 239-252-5026 or colliermuseums.com.

Vien Phommachanh – Comedian Vien Phommachanh, also known as “Comicdoc,” performs 7:30 p.m. August 16. Dr. Phommachanh is a practicing ear, nose and throat physician who enjoys a little comedy on the side. Tickets are $25. 1089 North Collier Boulevard #432, Marco Island. 239-394-4221 or www.marcoislandart.org.

Cars and Coffee – Mercato hosts Cars and Coffee 239 from 9 to 11 a.m. August 18. Browse cool cars, sip coffee, and listen to live music at 9110 Strada Place, Naples. 239-254-1080 or experiencemercato.com.

A Cracker at the Ritz – Satirists Compton & Bennett present their newest musical, A Cracker at the Ritz at 7 p.m. August 20. Enjoy an 85-minute satirical roasting of all things Florida in song and sketch comedy. Tickets are $35-$45. 10150 Bonita Beach Rd., Bonita Springs. 239-495-8989 or www.artsbonita.org.

Garden Tea Party – Shangri-La Springs hosts a Garden Tea Party 10 a.m.- 12:30 p.m. August 21. This event starts with a tour of the garden focusing on plants that can be used as tea followed by a tea party brunch. 27750 Old 41 Road, Bonita Springs. 239-949-0749 or www.shangrilasprings.com.

Water or Steel – Grand Piano Series presents Water or Steel—Contradictions of Piano Sound featuring Pianists Quang Vo and Duy Vo 7:30 p.m. August 22. Enjoy a spirited evening diving into the wide range of piano sounds. 5833 Pelican Bay Blvd., Naples. 239-597-1900 or www.artisnaples.org.

THEATER

Mary Poppins – At Broadway Palm Theatre through August 10. Nanny to the Banks family, Mary Poppins uses her magical abilities and wisdom to restore harmony and teach the importance of familial love. Matinee, evening, and twilight showings. Tickets start at $60. 1380 Colonial Blvd., Fort Myers. 239-278-4422 or www.broadwaypalm.com.

Murder Mystery – At Broadway Palm Theatre through August 10. Enjoy a fun night of murder mystery comedy with Murder On The 19th Hole. Matinee and evening showings. Tickets are $70 for a meal and show. 1380 Colonial Blvd., Fort Myers. 239-278-4422 or www.broadwaypalm.com.

EXHIBITS

The Cutting Edge – The world of art is constantly changing and embracing in new innovations. On exhibit through August 9, “The Cutting Edge” is the result of trying something new and testing boundaries when it comes to art. 10150 Bonita Beach Rd., Bonita Springs. 239-495-8989 or www.artsbonita.org.

Childhood Classics – On display at Naples Art Institute through August 11. Original artworks, contributions from classic illustrators, and beloved characters come to life in this whimsical exploration of children’s literature history. Tickets are $10 for members, $15 for non-members. 585 Park St., Naples. 239-262-6517 or www.naplesart.org.

“Floración” – Cecilia Valadez, Monika Bokelmann, Sonia Rosa, Julia Da Rocha, and Winnie Purple unique styles come together in this exhibition on display through September 5. Theses Latina artists explore deep connected with nature and themselves through many different media. 26100 Old 41 Road, Bonita Springs. 239-495-8989 or artsbonita.org.

Remember Us – Immokalee Pioneer Museum at Roberts Ranch presents “Remember Us” through September 7. An immersive showcase for residence to show off their creative and cultural practices. 1215 Roberts Avenue West, Immokalee. 239-252-2611 or colliermuseums.com.

Mansion Mayhem – The gang needs help. Join Scooby-Doo and Golisano Children’s Museum of Naples through September 8 for an interactive exhibit experience. Work with Mystery Inc. to solve the case of the jewel-thieving ghost. 15080 Livingston Road, Naples. 239-514-0084 or www.cmon.org.

Holiday Traditions – From Christmas Island style to Swamp Buggy races, Florida’s have their own style to celebrate the holiday. Marco Island Historical Museum features the exhibit “Holiday Traditions in Florida” through September 21. 180 South Heathwood Drive, Marco Island. 239-389-6447 or themihs.info/.

Internalizing The External – Ran Adler presents “Internalizing The External: A New Perspective On Nature” October 27. Alder transforms the rough material of the wild into works of beauty. On display Kapnick Hall and Fogg Café. 4820 Bayshore Drive, Naples. 239-643-7275 or www.naplesgarden.org.

The Ocean Decade – On display at the Rookery Bay Environmental Learning Center through October 31 “The Ocean Decade” exhibition. This exhibit features surreal digital art reenforcing the United Nations Ocean Decade initiative. Feel a deeper understanding of the ocean ecosystem and way of conservation. 300 Tower Road, Naples. 239-530-5940 or rookerybay.org.

Group Show – On display at the NAPLES ART STUDIOS through November 1. Enjoy a free art exhibition featuring work from local artists in mixed medias including watercolor, pastels, ceramics, and contemporary sculpture. 2172 J & C Boulevard, Naples. 239-821-1061 or naplesart.studio.

VENUES

Hertz Arena

11000 Everblades Parkway, Estero. www.hertzarena.com.

Regional Mexican Concert – Marca MP performs at Hertz Arena at 8 p.m. August 10 for their Simplemente Marca Tour 2024. Tickets start at $53.30. Parking is $30.

Artis—Naples

5833 Pelican Bay Blvd., Naples. 239-597-1900 or www.artisnaples.org.

The Motowners – The ultimate Motown tribute band, The Motowners performs classic hits from The Temptations, Four Tops, and many others 6&8:30 p.m. August 14-15.

Arts Bonita

10150 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. 239-495-8989 or artsbonita.org.

Broadway Today – Join Arts Bonita for an evening of cutting-edge music and dance 7 p.m. August 14. Enjoy musical hits from Broadways most popular shows. Tickets start at $25.

Off The Hook Comedy Club

2500 Vanderbilt Beach Rd #1100, Naples. 239-389-6901 or www.offthehookcomedy.com.

Jim Florentine – Live in Naples, comedian Jim Florentine brings the laughs 7 p.m. August 8. Tickets start at $25, and doors open at 5 p.m.

Tim Shropshire – Comedian Tim Shropshire takes the stage for two shows 6:30 & 8:30 p.m. August 9. Tickets start at $25, and doors open at 4:30 p.m.

Comedy Show – Two comedians, Marcus Monroe and Corey B, perform together for multiple shows August 10-11. Tickets start at $25.

Corey Cognac – Comedian Corey Cognac is live in Naples 7 p.m. August 14. Tickets start at $25, and doors open at 5 p.m. ¦
